(Monday August 3 2015), 14599=Danny Rose - An Expensive Admission of Failure (Tuesday August 4 2015), 12995=Martinez Never Feared Losing Stones (Monday August 3 2015), 13992=Chelsea in for Spurs Defender Rose (Tuesday August 4 2015), 13180=Lampard Makes US Debut (Monday August 3 2015), 26020=Time: 10:54AM, 13794=A Celebrity Fan with a Difference? (Monday August 3 2015), 14179=Ferdinand's Stones Rap (Tuesday August 4 2015), 29274=As we prepare for the roller-coaster ride that a trip to play Manchester City will inevitably resemble, we`ve an array of statistics for you to mull over. 1 - Chelsea will arrive at the Etihad Stadium in good defensive form having kept clean sheets in their last 3 Premier League away games. 2 - The record books show that the Etihad Stadium hasn`t been a happy hunting ground for Chelsea in recent times with Chelsea having lost on their last 4 Premier League visits. 3 - Looking at the bigger picture though, no Premier League team has won more away games at Manchester City than Chelsea, we`ve 10 victories to our name. 4 - Manchester City appear to like playing on a Monday night as they are unbeaten in their last 6 fixtures, winning 5 and drawing 1. However, the last team to beat them on a Monday night was.Chelsea, when we won 2-1 back in December 2011. 5 - With reference to Chelsea`s form in Monday night fixtures, 5 of our last 8 fixtures have ended in draws with 3 ending 0-0. 6 - City are in fine form at the Etihad Stadium having won the last 11 fixtures in a row. Bring it on is all I`ll say!, 13395="We`ll Use this Defeat as a Wake-Up Call" (Monday August 3 2015)}
